comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Looks like it might be the Senghenydd Colliery Disaster, the worst in British history--439 men died in an explosion or from being trapped in the damaged shafts, on 14 October 1913: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senghenydd_Colliery_Disaster

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I agree. See www.welshcoalmines.co.uk/GlamEast/Senghenydd.htm for a photo of the same site. More pictures are at the National Library of Wales: digidol.llgc.org.uk/METS/SEN00001/frames?div=0&subdiv...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca and swanq: Thanks for the additional infomation.  We'll include it in the record next time we update.

comment.author: 16041363@N00
comment._content: There are also some pictures of the Disaster (and Sengheydd today) in Kodak1927 stream www.flickr.com/photos/kodak1927/tags/senghenydd/
